activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on February 15, 2023 at 08:00 am.

1:42 PM Defendant Charles E Knowles in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Charles E Knowles. Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 21CF128 & 22CF127

22CF127-Arraingment 
Attorney Knaak waives further reading and NG plea entered. 
JT 2/15/23 #2

21CF128-
JT 2/15/23 #1

8:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles E Knowles in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow (for today only) in court for Charles E Knowles. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CF127 AND 21CF128

22CF127  
8:04 AM Atty. Rockow indicates defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant; defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hear and court accepts waiver.
Court finds probable cause; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.

21CF128:  Track with 22CF127 as a status conference.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 08:05 am.

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles E Knowles in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Charles E Knowles.
Attorney Knaak requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:05 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, except as may be prescribed by a licensed physician.

12:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles E Knowles appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg (for today) appeared by video for Charles E Knowles. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility; call today before being released from jail.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

AIA set

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
